title: Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Natalie Merchant performed a stripped-back concert at The Cabot in Beverly on November 9, 2025.
The show benefited Grateful Friends, a nonprofit assisting cancer patients with everyday expenses.
Merchant was accompanied only by guitarist Erik Della Penna, offering bare-bones renditions of her songs.

title: ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Many Massachusetts drivers find pedestrian-activated hybrid traffic lights confusing, with 59% of surveyed readers not understanding them.
A UMass Amherst study found nearly 25% of drivers went through solid red lights, and 65% through flashing reds when pedestrians were present.
Researchers and readers suggest better public education is needed to improve understanding and usage of hybrid traffic lights.

title: 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A fire at an off-campus apartment complex displaced 232 residents, including 230 UMass Amherst students.
The blaze started at a construction site and prompted a state of emergency; no injuries were reported.
The apartment complex was demolished due to instability, and displaced students received aid and temporary housing.

title: Gabriela Coletta Zapata says she has secured Boston City Council presidency
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Gabriela Coletta Zapata announced she secured enough votes to become the new Boston City Council president.
Coletta Zapata represents East Boston, Charlestown, and the North End and won reelection in District 1 with 82.5% of the vote.
Councilor Ruthzee Louijeune supports Coletta Zapata, who plans to focus on accessibility, collaboration, and improving public trust.

title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Henry Oberlander, 29, from Norwood, MA, passed away November 5, 2025, from a car accident.
Oberlander was a standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers High and Bridgewater State University; captained both teams.
Visiting hours are November 14, 2025, and a funeral mass on November 15, 2025, at Saint Mary's Church, Mansfield.

title: Boston.com readers share how the reduction in flights has impacted their travels
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: FAA reduced air traffic by up to 10% at 40 airports, including Logan, due to a government shutdown.
Logan Airport experienced 440 delays and 107 cancellations on Sunday, with further disruptions anticipated.
Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds as travelers face significant delays and cancellations.

title: Former Patriot Damien Woody made a bold prediction after New England’s win vs. Buccaneers
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Damien Woody predicts the AFC road to the Super Bowl goes through Foxborough after Patriots' 28-23 win over Buccaneers.
The Patriots are now 8-2, tied for the best record in the AFC with the Broncos and Colts.
Patriots have won seven consecutive games, showcasing a resurgence in their bid for NFL dominance.

title: Western Mass. police chief arrested in school parking lot, allegedly tried to solicit sex from undercover cop
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Cheshire Police Chief Michael Alibozek, 53, was arrested for allegedly soliciting sex from an undercover cop in a school parking lot.
Alibozek was placed on paid leave, and his firearm and police station access were seized after the arrest.
An emergency Selectboard meeting was held to appoint an acting chief, but none was named as of Monday morning.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Tewksbury crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 56-year-old Dracut man was seriously injured in a motorcycle crash in Tewksbury on Friday night.
The crash occurred near Brook Street and Janet Avenue, where the unconscious motorcyclist was found in woods off the roadway.
The injured man was airlifted to Lahey Hospital in Burlington and remained in critical condition as of Saturday afternoon.

title: Mike Vrabel had a blunt response to report about Titans owner’s alleged grudge
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismissed a report about Tennessee Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk not making trades with New England.
Vrabel emphasized player recovery and preparation for the upcoming Thursday night game against the Jets.
Vrabel acknowledged current Patriots team comparisons to past successful seasons but urged caution in making parallels.
